TITLE: Calculate your
SUBTITLE: BMI, BMR, TDEE, Daily water intake
VERY_ACTIVE: Very active (hard exercise/sports 6-7 days a week)
SUPER_ACTIVE: Super active (very hard exercise & physical job or 2x training)
BMI_DESCRIPTION: BMI is a simple calculation used to determine if your weight is appropriate for your height. It is commonly used as a general indicator of healthy body weight.
BMR_DESCRIPTION: BMR is the number of calories your body requires to perform its basic functions, like breathing, circulating blood, and maintaining body temperature, while at complete rest.
BMR_FORMULA_MEN: For Men: BMR = 13.7 × weight (kg) + 5.0 × height (cm) − 6.8 × age (years) + 66
BMR_FORMULA_WOMEN: For Women: BMR = 9.6 × weight (kg) + 1.8 × height (cm) − 4.7 × age (years) + 655
WHAT_IS_TDEE: What is TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure)?
TDEE_DESCRIPTION: TDEE is the total number of calories that your body requires in a day in order to maintain your current weight. This is also known as your maintenance level.
WATER_DESCRIPTION: Water is essential for life and maintaining optimal health. The human body is composed of approximately 60% water. It is recommended to drink at least 8 glasses of water per day.
